page.title: 09TRAFFIC IN HASTINGS
page.content: Traffic in the town have caused many problems. In the summer tourism brings many cars but there is not enough parking space in the town centre. Unfortunately road transport passing through the town has to travel along the promenade which can cause congestion. Trade with the rest of Britain is affected by poor transport facilities. The main road to London the A21 is often not duel carriageway and bends. The main railway line is slow but will soon be electrified and this will reduce the journey by 15 minutes. The road to the Channel ports is not always straight. If the Channel Tunnel was built Hastings industry would benefit considerably.
